body_html:
So the high-level question is still there: isn't this nest.flatten, tf.reverse, tf.scan, tf.reverse, nest.pack_as?
If so, it's fine to have the interface but is there a downside to wrap the code so that we don't have duplicate implementations to maintain?

body:
So the high-level question is still there: isn't this nest.flatten, tf.reverse, tf.scan, tf.reverse, nest.pack_as?
If so, it's fine to have the interface but is there a downside to wrap the code so that we don't have duplicate implementations to maintain?
